title: Order of the Lotus
body: Hi, I personally love the Order of the Lotus skin line and I was simply wondering has it been discontinued? Or is there still content coming for this skin line?

replies.body:
I love this fan art
https://i.gyazo.com/eaabe6940c5f36130dc40464ff91f15e.png

###### it's Taliyah

There's no plans right now, but it hasn't been retired. When working on the launch skins for Xaya and Rakan I did some brief sketches of OotL but they didn't really land (I tried a whole heap of themes). We don't have much SE Asia/Indian inspired designs though so I think they have plenty of potential in the future.

Are there any champions you think would be perfect for this theme? Is there something missing from the current skins that could take it to the next level? Please let me know >:)

I know this is pretty old Kindlejack but i think Akali, Sona and Soraka would make great additions to the OotL line. Since they all from Ionia which gives off a more asian-ish theme anyway i think theyd fit right in. Itd also make for a great trio release as well.
Good point! I always like to push the envelope when it comes to expectations from skins. But Something like OotL Sona could still fit between Sweetheart and Guqin.
Hey Kindlejack, just saw the 2016 SKT skins videos and its dope, you guys really held your word when you said you guys would up the ante on them as a commitment

I'm glad you enjoyed it. The team that made it are really cool and it was fun having them pointing cameras at us to shine a light on our passion. When I say that Rioters do care, it's because this is the environment I work in every day!

It was an honour to get to meet SKT and even sketch right in front of them, it helped to understand the players identities and what this means to them instead of just 'Skin_945' on the tracking sheet. I was also really impressed with the skins team and the way they stepped up. Traditionally there's only a few of us on skins who are fanatical about esports but I saw everyone watching games, asking questions and getting hyped.

I must add that ultimately it was our product owners who made the call last year to really 'up the ante', so we are lucky to have player focused Rioters at all levels of the company.

I hope we can continue to live up to expectations >:D
So this is going to be the direction of them moving forward I assume, I'm pretty happy about that except for the lack of World Cup in the skins. Always felt that was super iconic to the theme.
Yeah the sound on TPA Mundo's Q makes it my favourite skin by a mile - but I think you can see it doesn't fit in with the direction this year. It's a great point of feedback, thanks!

Yeah I'll concede it doesn't really fit the vibe of this year's skins. Also one more thing, if SKT does win worlds again would you guys consider giving Huni Lucian for his skin even if Bang played it or Bang like Ziggs for ADC
I honestly don't know right now. Last year it was down to the players to choose, from the champions they played, the one they wanted a skin for.

What about order of the Lotus Janna? this theme is practically MADE FOR HER.
I see flower pedals flying EVERYWHERE. I think a pedal inspiered skin would fit janna perfectly.

I see kkoma seems to be getting a ward skin, which seems like a reasonable compromise to not getting a traditional worlds skin.

Is it likely that will be a one off coach recognition (at least until someone else of kkomas calibre shows up), or might coaches of future world champions start getting a ward skin of their own? (Or is this not something that's been given much thought at this stage as you focus on getting this batch out?)

Yeah, no one in LoL's short history has achieved what Kkoma has. We acknowledge an exceptional achievement with this ward skin!

Going forward I think each year will be different and really depend on the circumstances around the winning team. You're right in that we've definitely thought about how the last two years of World Champion skins will affect the future, particularly with SKT's current performance with Peanut and Huni! But much of my focus in my last year on skins was pushing to destabilise things we were doing just because we'd done it that way in the past as I think that does more harm than good.

Personally I think the team should make skins because we think players will love them, not because we need to meet expectations; if we think it's the right thing to do then we shouldn't be beholden to pricing tiers, traditions or expectations. Hypothetically if we want to put VO on a 1350, custom anims on a 750, make 3 skins for the same champion in a year, make a skin that is 1013rp, connect two skin lines with an event, make lore skins, expand on an ultimate theme at different tiers, release pool party skins in December, paint a splash in a photo-real style, make yet another goofy skin for Mundo or [remove a champion's hat](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/FjxM30bH-pulsefire-caitlyn-shape?show=flat) the question we should ask ourselves isn't 'Is this in line with the expectations we have created' but rather 'Is this fucking cool'.

This needs much more upvotes, people. Show your support to someone who has the right attitude.

I loved that video too, it was very interesting. A question: is this the usual way you work on skins, or did you tread SKT skins in a special way?
You obviously don't usually involve pro teams in skin development and you obviously discuss skins a lot, but is it always as much as you showed in this video?
Yeah absolutely we put a lot of time and love into every skin!
they really look excellent, like a pantheon of gods, which is very fitting
Are they lore skins or alternate universes? I thought it reflected a top level society after the war?

Initially they weren't defined. The Karma skin was alternate universe as it reflects a real world region's style in a similar way to her other skins - so it wasn't intended as lore.

When working on Xaya and Rakan's launched skins it was a theme I explored and had some idea about what it could represent going forward. To be continued...

I still think Illaoi can fit into the OotL universe. She's already a priestress of a kind and spiritual skins, like OotL and Blood Moon seem very fitting to her identity by nature. Curse my lack of creativity to imagine how she could look like, but lotus flowers can be used as tentacles, with petals flying through the air when she uses her slam.

Just a small idea I had in my mind for her for quite a while^^
if the fan Art for the OOTL Taliyah actually became real and was a 1350 skin i'd cry in spanish and love you forever plis ;A;

Well I'm not sure it fits entirely because it features the wrong plant, haha, but I've always wanted to see a Maokai skin with an asian-esque bonsai-cherry blossoms theme. Maybe it could fit within Order of the Lotus despite not being a lotus flower! :)

Cherry blossom and bonsai kinda more points in the direction of japan, though.
Which means Bloodmoon could probably be more fitting.
I think I imagine a more serene stand-alone skin in that case! :)
Gotta be honest: You definitely should make an own thread about this skin idea since I absolutely love the imagination and it deserves more attenion than being burrowed in here. ^^
On rare occasions I dabble in painting skin concepts ; might attempt one for _Cherry Blossom Bonsai Maokai_ at some point!

There was a thread about this on the Concepts & Creations boards recently, and I think there are definitely a few strong candidates.

From Ionia (since that's the strongest connection currently) you have Akali and Jhin. The former has a number of cool flower effects you could have (petals exploding in her cloud, etc), and the latter almost speaks for itself with his existing flower thematics and the chance to design some outfits with his flowing fabrics and exaggerated motions. A Shen skin where the blade is a floating lotus blossom could also be really cool, with petals bursting out to mark his dodge field, and a flowerly shield around the target of his ultimate.

On the existing-skin subject? Karma is pretty cool, but I'm not sure Irelia sells the theme enough -- I feel more could have been done with making her blades look like petals, and maybe a bit more oomph could have been added to her particle effects. It feels more like a skin recolor than the Karma skin, which really sells the alternate fantasy.

I feel like Janna would be perfect for the OotL theme, given her calm personality. Also just look at this concept:
https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/originals/dd/e0/cd/dde0cdda85d63bdf593477b0724c7ca2.png
I mean, that Taliyah fanart is pretty good
It is! So good in fact that Steve Zheng has been freelancing for us :)

I also thought Xin Zhao could potentially be cool, but idk how much appeal the thematic would have to his players. Jhin could be an interesting twist too, if he was like a corrupt or traitorous member of the order?

Order of The Lotus Jhin.

He's an Ionian, he already has a strong flower motiff with a focus on elegance, he already looks good in pastels, and it'd be great to get a male champion into the Lotus club.

On that last note, maybe also Order of The Lotus Taric? Could draw inspiration from decorational glass / crystal / gemstone flowers and bonsai trees.
{{champion:134}} hasn't gotten a skin in a while. Why not her?
If we're giving skins to champion's who haven't gotten them in a while, Viktor, Cass, Yorick, Malzahar, etc. should get them.
true, but how many of them are Ionian and would fit the thematic of this skin?
Soraka is Ionian and fits the theme.
I can agree to this

tbh I could see Nami or Zyra fit OotL pretty well. Or if you wanted to be a little more daring Kalista and Diana.

OotL Kalista sounds really cool in all honesty

Syndra would be a rad design, though maybe she's too angry. Would love the pink death orbs though.

Xin? Jax. Yi! Janna... FLOWER TORNADO! Also Yasuo for that matter. SO many options.
What's the intent of the skin line? I'm guessing it's not lore related?

Akali would be nice , with a flower to indicate her Q bonus damage , and flower effects on her W and E. That being said , Akali is in line for a full VGU , so I imagine that she won't be getting any skins over 950 4 a while now. 
Wukong would be glorious in so many ways. The gorgeous flower effects on the monkey king would be absolutely astounding + the room for creativity in the splash art is immense . 
Shenpai would be a nice addition + he deserves a nice skin with all the bells and whistles. 

Now , I kind want this skin to be a Ionian only. But , if you so happen to not make it Ionian only these champions would fit.
Zyra , need I say more
Udyr , while he doesn't really have much room as far as effects go , I could most definitely see him as part of the OotL. He did spend quite some time in Ionia + did defend Ionia in the Ionia vs Noxus match (Not sure if still cannon tho)
Nami , since the lotus Flower is aquatic and she goes quite well with a flower theme
I have a friend who'd love it for Katarina, sorta like Order of the Death Lotus

Reading your reply I was thinking of who would fit. I think OotL is a theme that fits only a few selected champions. I associate OotL to control, method, meditation, inner calm. It's not a skin line I'd see on Tryndamere, or Olaf, or even Taliyah or Nami. It makes me think of monastic training, someone who fights with perfect control of his body, someone who does kata, with a mind of steel. And I'm surprised of who I thought would fit all these features perfectly: Lee Sin. He has a lot of skins already, and it wouldn't be too daring to make him a skin with a light pink palette. The only problem that maybe could be that he already has a lot of skins thematically linked to monasteries and martial arts (but then again, it's his trope, so it's not that suprising)
Another champ who maybe could fit (because she does a kata with her /d) is Riven, but I'm less sure here: she's still young and reckless... maybe she could be an OotL apprentice/trainee? A talented and promising apprentice for sure, but who is still moving towards her inner peace.
I was thinking if Syndra or Varus could fit the theme too, maybe as alternate fantasies (both being "evil and corrupted by their power"), but they don't make me feel as excited. What do you think? (damn, now I want to draw some concepts of lee and riven, if only I was a better artist xD)
